ent.origin: Old English beforan (see by, fore), of Germanic origin; related to German bevor.

p.def: During the period of time preceding (a particular event or time).
p.eg: She had to rest before dinner.
They lived rough for four days before they were arrested.

p.def: as an adverb (without a following noun).
p.eg: His playing days had ended six years before.

ent.rhy: abhor, adore, afore, anymore, ashore, awe, bandore, Bangalore, boar, Boer, bore, caw, chore, claw, cocksure, comprador, cor, core, corps, craw, Delors, deplore, door, draw,
